Technique: HEWN; POLISHED; UNSPECIFIED STONE-TECHNIQUE; ENGRAVED; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB; SCULPTURED
Name: Canopic jar of Ankh-neferibre
Description: This canopic jar (see E.5898) was once in the G. Hagemans collection and bears the name Ankhneferibre. It has a lid in the shape of a human head and a text referring to Amset the Son of Horus. The Museum in Brussels (E.5893) and the Egyptian Museum in Berlin (inv. 7176) each have another canopic jar belonging to the same man, who probably lived around the end of the 26th Dynasty.
